issues.description: The problem statement refers to a method named 'linkParent(Person person, Person parent)' as part of the PersonService API, but both the template and the solution repositories implement and refer to this functionality as 'addParent(Person person, Person parent)'. This naming mismatch can confuse students who look for a 'linkParent' method in the starter code or tests and may cause them to implement the wrong method name or search for a non-existent symbol.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the identifier across artifacts. Change the problem statement to refer to 'addParent(Person person, Person parent)' (or explicitly note that 'linkParent' and 'addParent' are the same) so it matches the template and solution. Alternatively, rename the template/solution method to 'linkParent' if that name is preferred, but ensure all artifacts (problem statement, tests, template code) use the same name.
